keyword: how many calories in a bowl of spaghetti
title: How Many Calories in a Bowl of Spaghetti?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a bowl of spaghetti, including carbs, protein, fat, and full nutrition breakdown for a standard 200g serving.
h1: How Many Calories in a Bowl of Spaghetti?
assumptions: Plain boiled spaghetti, no sauce or oil; standard bowl serving size ~200g cooked weight.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by pasta type, brand, portion size, and cooking method. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A standard bowl of plain cooked spaghetti (200g) contains about 316 calories and 12g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tbsp olive oil while cooking

faqs.q: How many calories in a bowl of spaghetti with sauce?
faqs.a: Plain is ~316 kcal for 200g; adding 100g marinara sauce brings it to about 396 kcal.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in a bowl of spaghetti?
faqs.a: Around 62g carbs in a 200g bowl of plain cooked spaghetti.
A 200g bowl provides ~12g protein, moderate for a carb-focused food.

faqs.q: How does portion size affect calories in spaghetti?
faqs.a: Calories scale with weight; 100g is ~158 kcal, so a larger bowl (300g) would be ~474 kcal.

faqs.q: Does cooking method change calories in spaghetti?
faqs.a: Boiled plain is lowest; adding oil or butter increases fat and calories significantly.
